meanings.definition: The quality or state of being vulgar.
meanings.sent1: Her constant vulgarity made it hard to enjoy the conversation.
meanings.sent2: The vulgarity of his jokes made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his attempts at humor, his vulgarity only elicited awkward chuckles.
meanings.sent4: The vulgarity of the graffiti on the wall shocked passersby.
meanings.sent5: The vulgarity of the situation left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: Inappropriate or offensive language or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's vulgarity crossed the line of decency.
meanings.sent2: She was taken aback by the vulgarity of the movie dialogue.
meanings.sent3: The vulgarity of the situation was so extreme that it became comical.
meanings.sent4: His vulgarity was like a slap in the face to those around him.
meanings.sent5: The vulgarity of his remarks lingered in the air long after he had left.
